message.description: Log message optimized for viewing in a log viewer.

tags.description: List of keywords used to tag each event.

client.bytes.description: Bytes sent from the client to the server.

client.packets.description: Packets sent from the client to the server.

client.user.name.description: Short name or login of the user.

destination.bytes.description: Bytes sent from the destination to the source.

destination.packets.description: Packets sent from the destination to the source.

destination.user.name.description: Short name or login of the user.

event.action.description: The action captured by the event.

event.category.description: Event category representing the type of the event.

event.created.description: Time when the event was first read or created.

event.duration.description: Duration of the event in nanoseconds.

event.id.description: Unique ID to describe the event.

event.module.description: Name of the module this data is coming from.

event.original.description: Raw text message of entire event.

event.risk_score.description: Risk score or priority of the event.

event.severity.description: Severity of the event on a scale.

file.accessed.description: Last time the file was accessed.

file.ctime.description: Last time the file attributes or metadata changed.

file.directory.description: Directory where the file is located.

file.gid.description: Primary group ID (GID) of the file.

file.group.description: Primary group name of the file.

file.inode.description: Inode representing the file in the filesystem.

file.mode.description: Mode of the file in octal representation.

file.mtime.description: Last time the file content was modified.

file.name.description: Name of the file including the extension.

file.uid.description: The user ID (UID) or security identifier (SID) of the file owner.

host.domain.description: Name of the domain of which the host is a member.

host.uptime.description: Seconds the host has been up.

host.os.family.description: OS family (such as redhat, debian, windows).

host.os.full.description: Operating system name, including the version or code name.

host.os.kernel.description: Operating system kernel version as a raw string.

host.os.name.description: Operating system name, without the version.

host.os.type.description: Use the os.type field to categorize the operating system.

host.os.version.description: Operating system version as a raw string.

http.request.body.bytes.description: Size in bytes of the request body.

http.request.bytes.description: Total size in bytes of the request (body and headers).

http.request.mime_type.description: Mime type of the body of the request.

http.response.body.bytes.description: Size in bytes of the response body.

http.response.bytes.description: Total size in bytes of the response (body and headers).

http.response.mime_type.description: Mime type of the body of the response.

log.file.path.description: Full path to the log file this event came from.

log.level.description: Log level of the log event.

log.origin.file.line.description: The line number of the file containing the source code.

log.origin.file.name.description: The name of the file containing the source code.

log.origin.function.description: The name of the function or method.

log.syslog.facility.code.description: Syslog numeric facility of the event.

log.syslog.facility.name.description: Syslog text-based facility of the event.

log.syslog.severity.code.description: Syslog numeric severity of the event.

log.syslog.severity.name.description: Syslog text-based severity of the event.

network.bytes.description: Total bytes transferred in both directions.

network.community_id.description: A hash of source and destination IPs and ports.

network.forwarded_ip.description: Host IP address when the source IP is the proxy.

network.name.description: Name given by operators to sections of their network.

network.packets.description: Total packets transferred in both directions.

network.transport.description: Protocol name from the OSI transport layer.

network.type.description: Protocol name from the OSI network layer.

process.command_line.description: Full command line that started the process.

process.executable.description: Absolute path to the process executable.

process.exit_code.description: The exit code of the process.

process.pgid.description: Identifier of the group of processes the process belongs to.

process.uptime.description: Seconds the process has been up.

process.working_directory.description: The working directory of the process.

process.parent.args.description: Array of process arguments for the parent process.

process.parent.command_line.description: Full command line that started the parent process.

process.parent.executable.description: Absolute path to the parent process executable.

process.parent.start.description: The time the parent process started.

server.bytes.description: Bytes sent from the server to the client.

server.packets.description: Packets sent from the server to the client.

server.user.name.description: Short name or login of the user.

source.bytes.description: Bytes sent from the source to the destination.

source.packets.description: Packets sent from the source to the destination.

source.user.name.description: Short name or login of the user.

source.geo.postal_code.description: Postal code associated with the location.

source.geo.timezone.description: The time zone of the location.

url.extension.description: The file extension from the original request URL.

url.fragment.description: Portion of the URL after the #.

url.original.description: Unmodified original URL as seen in the event source.

url.query.description: The query field describes the query string.

url.subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of a fully qualified domain name.

user.domain.description: Name of the directory the user is a member of.

user.group.domain.description: Name of the directory the group is a member of.

user.hash.description: Unique user hash to correlate information for a user.

user.name.description: Short name or login of the user.

user.roles.description: Array of user roles at the time of the event.

user_agent.os.family.description: OS family (such as redhat, debian, windows).

user_agent.os.full.description: Operating system name, including the version or code name.

user_agent.os.kernel.description: Operating system kernel version as a raw string.

user_agent.os.name.description: Operating system name, without the version.

user_agent.os.type.description: Use the os.type field to categorize the operating system.

user_agent.os.version.description: Operating system version as a raw string.
